meanings.sent1: After playing outside all day, he tires quickly.
meanings.sent2: She tires easily after a long day at work.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tires out after chasing its tail for hours.
meanings.sent4: The engine tires as it struggles to climb the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The runner tires near the finish line but pushes through.

meanings.sent1: He tires of watching the same movie over and over.
meanings.sent2: Children tire of waiting in long lines.
meanings.sent3: She tires quickly of listening to the same song on repeat.
meanings.sent4: The students tire of studying for exams.
meanings.sent5: I tire of hearing the same jokes every day.

meanings.definition: A rubber covering on a wheel to provide traction and reduce friction
meanings.sent1: The new tires on the car grip the road well.
meanings.sent2: He checked the pressure in the tires before the road trip.
meanings.sent3: The worn-out tires on the bike need replacing.
meanings.sent4: The tractor's tires sank into the muddy field.
meanings.sent5: The snow tires help the car navigate icy roads.
